title: Cumin Lamb Stir-Fry
description: A quick, fragrant stir-fry of thinly sliced lamb seared with toasted cumin and warm aromatics. Brightened with scallions, bell pepper, and a splash of soy-accented sauce for a savory, slightly smoky finish.

ingredients.display_name: lamb leg or shoulder, thinly sliced against the grain
ingredients.notes: partially freeze for 20 minutes to make slicing easier
toast whole seeds then grind for best flavor or use ground cumin
adds color and sweetness; can substitute with green

ingredients.display_name: dark soy sauce or oyster sauce (for color and depth)
ingredients.notes: optional for richer color and umami
toss with meat and sauce to create a thin glaze
included separately for clarity of technique

ingredients.display_name: neutral oil (vegetable or canola) for high-heat cooking
crushed red chili flakes or fresh chili, minced

steps.text: Prepare the lamb by patting dry and slicing thinly against the grain; toss the sliced lamb with a tablespoon of soy sauce and one teaspoon cornstarch and let rest while you prep aromatics.
If using cumin seeds, toast them in a dry skillet until fragrant then grind; otherwise measure ground cumin and mix with garlic, ginger, and optional chili to form a spice mix.
Heat a wok or large skillet over high heat until very hot, add neutral oil and swirl to coat the surface.
Add the lamb in a single layer, searing undisturbed for about 45 seconds to 1 minute to develop browning, then stir-fry continuously until nearly cooked through and just browned.

Push the lamb to the side and add another small splash of oil if needed, then add the white parts of the scallions, bell pepper, and the garlic-ginger-cumin mixture; stir-fry together until aromatics are softened and fragrant.

Combine the sauce ingredients (remaining soy sauce, rice vinegar, optional dark soy, sugar or honey) in a small bowl, pour over the meat and vegetables, toss to coat and let the sauce bubble and thicken slightly to glaze everything.
Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper, finish with sesame oil and the green parts of the scallions, toss once more, then remove from heat.
Let rest for 1–2 minutes, then serve hot over cauliflower rice, steamed rice, or greens as preferred.
